node.title: Here's what you need to know about Hanukkah 2021
node.alt: A lamp with nine candles on a table next to a plate of potato pancakes on a wooden table.
node.description: From lighting candles to eating jelly donuts: Here is how the eight-day celebration of the Festival of Lights unfolds.
node.content:
["People gather around the world to celebrate\u00a0Hanukkah, and\u00a0the festival is one of the most-beloved Jewish holidays.", "Hanukkah \u2014 Hebrew for \"dedication\"\u2014 is also known as Chanukah or the Festival of Lights.\u00a0", "The eight-day celebration\u00a0remembers the\u00a0rededication of the Second Temple in Jerusalem, Israel.", "Hanukkah has gained growing appreciation worldwide and is even a recognised holiday at the White House, with US presidents hosting annual Menorah lightings and parties.\u00a0", "
When is Hanukkah 2021?
", "This year, Hanukkah began on Sunday, November 28 and finishes on Monday, December 6.", "The date of the celebration is determined by\u00a0the 25th day of the Jewish month of Kislev.", "Based on the lunar cycle, the Jewish calendar sees the first day of Hanukkah anywhere from late November to December on the Gregorian calendar.", "
What is the history behind Hanukkah?
", "Unlike other Jewish holidays, Hanukkah is not mentioned in the Torah, which includes\u00a0the first five books of the Hebrew Bible.", "The story of Hanukkah is recorded in the post-biblical Books of the Maccabees.\u00a0", "Importantly, Hanukkah\u00a0commemorates the victory of the\u00a0Maccabees, a small army of Jewish people, fighting against the\u00a0army of King Antiochus IV of Syria.", "In 168 BC, the Seleucid Greek empire ruled over\u00a0Jerusalem and outlawed\u00a0Jewish practice.", "They also\u00a0desecrated the Jewish Temple.\u00a0", "After the Maccabees won the battle and regained the Temple, one oil bottle\u00a0was found and used to illuminate the Temple's\u00a0menorah for one day, but the flame burnt for eight full days.", "The Jewish people saw the long-lasting oil as a miracle.\u00a0", "
How do people celebrate Hanukkah?
", "Over the eight nights, people celebrate Hanukkah by lighting one candle each night on the menorah.", "The menorah holds nine candles, and is placed in the doorway or window during Hanukkah.\u00a0", "The shammash, or servant candle, is lit first and\u00a0used to help light the others.\u00a0", "On the first night of\u00a0Hanukkah, the candle on the far right is lit, and on the second night, the candle on the far left is lit.\u00a0", "A new candle is put in the\u00a0menorah from right to left each night, and lit in the reverse\u00a0order\u00a0(newest to oldest).", "A blessing is offered while each\u00a0candle\u00a0is\u00a0lit.\u00a0", "", "
People celebrate\u00a0Hanukkah by lighting the menorah, playing games and eating oily foods.\u00a0(Unsplash:\u00a0Benigno Hoyuela)
", "To further celebrate the festive, people play\u00a0dreidel\u00a0(spinning top) and\u00a0also give each other\u00a0gelt (chocolate gold foiled coins).", "When King Antiochus IV ruled, all Jewish practices, including reading and studying the Torah, were banned.\u00a0", "The Jewish community would study the Torah in secret by pretending to play dreidel.\u00a0", "A dreidel's\u00a0four sides feature\u00a0the Hebrew letters\u00a0Nun, Gimel, Hay and Shin. Together, they translate\u00a0to \"a great miracle happened there\".\u00a0", "Food fried in oil is also used to symbolise the long-lasting oil event.\u00a0", "Traditional\u00a0Hanukkah foods include\u00a0latkes (potato pancakes), kugel (noodle or potato casserole)\u00a0and\u00a0sufganiyot (jelly doughnuts).\u00a0", "", "
Millions of jelly donuts are sold yearly in\u00a0Israel during\u00a0Hanukkah.\u00a0(Unsplash:\u00a0Benigno Hoyuela\u00a0)
", "
How do I wish my friends a happy Hanukkah?\u00a0
", "The traditional greeting for observing Hanukkah is \"Hanukkah sameach!\" which means \"Happy Hanukkah!\" or \"Chag urim sameach\" which means \"Happy Festival of Lights\".", "If you want to join in the celebrations, Hanukkah events are held by local governments and community groups across Australia every year,\u00a0and are often promoted as\u00a0Chanukah."]
